Story.title: Lil: Take This School and Shove It
Story.Description: Lil has always refused to be hammered into any square holes, but now that high school's almost over, her poser-hating, adorably/annoyingly mopey persona is about to have a violent confrontation with Real Life. Will she spend her last few days on a quest to go out with a bang? Change her attitude? Or change the people around her?

GoalDescription.words: You know, maybe it wouldn't be the end of the world if Lil strutted her stuff a little. Her mom'll be happy, at least.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Make sure that Lil ###LIL### has a date ###DATING###
Get at least four people to think that Lil ###LIL### is totally cool ###COOL UP###

TidBit.text: Lil is unexpectedly developing a reputation for coolness. Who knew?
Suddenly, everyone in school is talking about Lil. She's such an iconoclast! Whatever that means.
People are starting to buzz about Lil. She's been so quiet since sixth grade, but now??
Lil is riding an unexpected wave of popularity. These sheep are starting to appreciate her.

GoalDescription.words: It's unlikely Lil is going to see these losers ever again. If she plays her cards right this week, she can guarantee it.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Make Lil ###LIL### have at least six enemies ###ENEMIES###

TidBit.text: Lil is tearing this school a new one. Where did *this* side of her come from?
Lil's decided she's got nothing to lose. She wants to go out with a bang.
Lil is on fire. The freshmen will be telling the legend of her prom week for years to come.
Better not let anyone get in Lil's way. She's using shock and awe tactics on her soon-to-be-former classmates.
The rest of these sheeple will never forget Lil.

GoalDescription.words: If Lil is going to redefine herself post-high school, it'll help if she starts with a clean slate.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: End all of Lil's ###LIL### friendships ###NOT FRIENDS###
Make peace with all of Lil's ###LIL### enemies ###NOT ENEMIES###
Break it off with anyone that Lil ###LIL### is dating ###NOT DATING###

TidBit.text: Lil's fading away like a ghost. Soon nobody will remember her at all.
Cutting connections one by one... Lil can't wait to ditch this life and start over with a less pathetic crowd.
Who do these posers think they are? Lil hates them all with a passion.
These so called friends are shallow, mindless zombies. She won't miss them.
Only a few days left till high school is over and Lil never has to interact with these idiots again.

GoalDescription.words: Lucas and Phoebe are clearly perfect for each other. Too bad bow-and-arrows aren't allowed on campus.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Orchestrate a dating-caliber romance ###DATING### between Lucas ###LUCAS### and Phoebe ###PHOEBE###

TidBit.text: Lucas and Phoebe have been some of the only people to be nice to Lil over the years. Maybe she can repay them somehow.
Phoebe and Lucas are so right for each other. Lil's determined to make sure they end up together and happy.
All Lil wants is for Lucas and Phoebe to leave high school with a glowing future.
Lil's final mission is to make sure Phoebe and Lucas end up happy, popular, and together.
Lil never thought she'd be a matchmaker, but she's determined to get Lucas and Phoebe together no matter what.

GoalDescription.words: The popular crowd has been pretty merciless throughout the school year. Maybe it's time to destroy them from within.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Get Buzz ###BUZZ### and Cassandra ###CASSANDRA### to stop dating ###NOT DATING###

TidBit.text: Looks like Lil's turning the status quo into the status quon't.

Level.title: Monday: Yearbook Signing
Level.Description: All anyone else can think about is writing something stupid in as many yearbooks as possible. Lil used hers to start a fire and now she's got more important things to do.

Level.title: Tuesday: Corner Store
Level.Description: It's the last chance for the Goths and Emos to ditch class and pretend to ignore each other. But Lil's not feeling sentimental. It's *her* last chance to shake things up a bit.

Level.title: Wednesday: Nightmares on Elm Street
Level.Description: The popular kids are all hanging out in their suburban wasteland between trips to the mall. Lil has some business to take care of with the so-called 'cool' crowd.

Level.title: Thursday: Last Day in Homeroom
Level.Description: Only one more day left to bring Lil's plans to fruition.

Level.title: Friday: THE PROM
Level.Description: The last gasp of high school, the final night among these plebes. Will Lil's hard work pay off? Will this be a night to remember?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well Lil, I wouldn't have believed it possible but....
YOU'RE THE FREAKING PROM QUEEN!
Everyone wants to be like you now. Monica is making an appointment with her stylist to get her hair done like yours. How did you do it?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I just finally realized... trying to be like everyone else is a sucker's game.
But trying to reject everything is just as pointless. Not to mention a *total* cliche.
Just be yourself, %r%. At maximum volume if possible.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That's cool, but I sort of feel like I'm in some after-school special now.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hell yeah. It's called 'Lil's world.'

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Lil, can you believe this drama that's happening with the popular kids?
I've never heard of a senior prom with this much misery.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I know. Isn't it wonderful?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Wait a minute... did *you* have something to do with this?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Let's just say I thought it was high time some people got what they had coming to them.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well, I guess they deserved it after they way they treated us all those years, huh?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh, nah.
It was more the way they treated each other.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Lil, Doug reporting%if(0,... reluctantly...)% for the school newspaper. %if(1,In a *ahem* purely professional capacity. )%You've just been named Coldest Senior for your crazy antics in the past week. Any comment?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Look Doug, I'm not talking into your little mike. And who ever gave a #@!$ about the school newspaper anyway?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well look, I'm just curious. What got into you this week? You went from loser to bruiser.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: That's the stupidest thing I've ever heard. Did you just make that up?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't know! Don't hurt me!
Look, what's gotten into you? Why did you go so crazy this week? What's going on?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: You want to know? Hmm. Lean closer, and I'll tell you.
The secret is that this is the end of the world.
High school is over man. Next week we all start Real Life. Whatever we were in high school, who was popular and who wasn't, that all ends here, tonight, at the prom.
Once you realize that the world's ending, it sets you free. To be as crazy or as sane as you want.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Duuude.... you just blew my mind.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Yeah. I'm thinking of majoring in philosophy. Or maybe starting a circus.
It's done. I've done it. Finally. No friends, no enemies, no throwaway romances.
I've made a clean break with this worthless school and these idiots who think it's all so important.
I mean, look at %r% there.
Texting away, lost in %pron(r,his/her)% own little world, totally oblivious to everything.
Next week is the start of a new life. After this, everything changes.
In the real world, people will respect me for who I am.
I'll seek out people who are genuine, who care about what's real. Do what I love. Maybe travel the world.
And when in ten years these sheeple are all planning their high school reunion, I'll be surfing in Maui or running for president or buying a private island or something.
I mean, the real world can't be as pointless and insipid and unfair as high school, can it?
...can it?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well, the music is terrible, the decor is totally classless, and I hate the vast majority of these people for one reason or another...
But this is still the best prom ever.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Is it? Why the change of heart?
Oh, I think I know why. And she's coming this way.
Hey Phoebe! Should I give the two of you some time alone?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Oh, never you worry, we'll be spending plenty of time together. Isn't that right, %sweetie%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That's right, %sweetie%. Hey, didn't you manage to get a date to the prom, Lil?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %if(2,Sure)else(Nah)%. But that's not important right now.
What's important is... the two of you rock, and you totally deserve to be together.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Hold that thought. %sweetie%, I'll be right back. I'm going to go spike the punch.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Wow, Phoebe is pretty amazing.
You know, you're gonna think I'm phsycho, but I feel like you were... kind of watching over us, you know? Arranging things to get us together.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: What? Like some creepy puppet master controlling everything you do, like some sort of game?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Probably just my imagination. Where's Phoebe? I'm gonna go kiss her now.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: OK, you love birds. I'm out of here. Where's that punch...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well, Lil, how's your Prom been so far?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Don't pretend to make small talk with me, %r%. How totally lame.
...I guess it's been different than I was expecting.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: How so?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I don't know... I had all these crazy plans at the start of the week, to shake things up, or drop out of social life entirely, or... just do something memorable to mark the occasion, you know?
But in the end... who really cares about prom, you know?
We're all going to move on to bigger and better things next year anyway, and leave all this maudlin crap behind us.
Or I will, at least. You'll probably be working at a gas station and %gender(r,juggling ex-wives,pumping out kids)% five years from now.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Charming, Lil. I'm glad to see some things never change.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: No, wait... hey. Despite everything... going to high school with you could have sucked more, you know?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Was that a compliment?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: At least it wasn't an insult.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: We'll always have that, Lil. We'll always have that.
